----- Original Message -----
From: <josh.knowles@...>

>
> I want to modify only the name for the resource located
> at /addressbook/000001, do I POST the changes to the name or do I
> PUT them.  Also, do I need to PUT the entire record or just the
> changes?

If you use PUT you need to send the complete data for the resource - which I
think is messed up in the protocol but I'm not a protocol guy (there are
reasons like caching,etc that may require this behavior).
So, use PUT to do a 'partial update' of a resource. You could also define a
more fine-grained resource and PUT to that...

-- option 1 : partial update via POST --
POST /addressbook/0001 HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: text/xml
Content-Length: nnnn

<contact>
 <name>bob</name>
 <phone>425-555-1212</phone>
 <email>bob@...</email>
</contact>


-- option 2 : fine-grained update via PUT --
PUT /addressbook/0001;email HTTP/1.1
Content-Type: text/xml
Content-Length: nnnn

<email>bob@...</email>
